column2: San, 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was given DILT-CD for high blood pressure. It has been the only medication that I have not had  any significant side effect; nevertheless, I will continue to take it despite some incidence of pain in my breast and frequent unrination.

column2: steph, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took this drug for about 6 weeks, at first some adjustments , feeling off-balance, etc. then swelling around the eyes, face felt tight, then tightness in chest, feelings of dread, overall awfulness. Had to go to the ER , thought I was having a heart attack. I will never take another calcium channel blocker!!!

column2: Freedom Dreamer, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I've been taking this medication for 24 years to control chest pains and Reynauld' Syndrome.  I take it at bedtime and don't get bothered by the side effects because they come when I'm asleep (night sweats).

column2: tennesseeRN, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I began taking this after a bout with PVCs (as a result of taking diet pills) and thought I could quit taking the medication because I felt great while taking it. No more problems. But as soon as I went off of it, my heart began doing the same thing only worse. I have since went back on it and my heart is doing fine. I am taking 120 mg a day and it works great with no side effects what so ever for me.
